mailServer.name: EnTech Mail
mailServer.email:
Hi Riley,
I hope you're doing well. I wanted to ask you to help me out with making a list of our old data at Romulus server that needs retaining, and what can be deleted. Not sure I can directly send you the server info, our security API's going crazy on forwarding Ben's emails. So check them out in my account, the pass is "JubAWJUR". Once you're logged in, you'll find the email with the subject "Server Shutdown and Old Project Files - Urgent" in the inbox.
Thank you for your help with this, and let me know if you need any further assistance.
Best, Amelia

email.subject: RE(3): Urgent: Server Shutdown and Old Project Files

mailServer.email:
Ben,
Great, I'll make sure to have that list ready for our meeting. It's a mix of project files, some of which are still relevant, and others that can be archived or deleted, so I'll categorize them accordingly.
I appreciate your cooperation on this. See you at 10 AM in the IT conference room. -Amelia ---
Amelia,
Thank you for your cooperation as well. I'll be ready to discuss the technical aspects of shutting down the Romulus server and the best practices for data security. Let's make sure this transition goes smoothly.
See you at 10 AM.
Best regards, -Ben

email.subject: RE(2): Urgent: Server Shutdown and Old Project Files

mailServer.email:
Ben,
Thank you for your prompt response. I think a meeting is a good idea. How about tomorrow at 10 AM in the IT conference room? Does that work for you?
-Amelia ---
Amelia,
That time works for me. I'll be there at 10 AM tomorrow in the IT conference room. In the meantime, it would be helpful if you could prepare a list of the project files that need to be retained and those that can be safely archived or deleted. This will help us streamline the process. I think you should be able to access the server with the password "h7ggNKl2", it should help you make the list.
Looking forward to our meeting. -Ben

email.subject: RE: Urgent: Server Shutdown and Old Project Files

mailServer.email:
Hey Ben,
I hope this email finds you well. As you know, we've successfully completed the transition to our new location, and it's time to address the Romulus server, the one at 156.151.1.12, which still houses some old project files. I wanted to discuss the process for shutting it down and ensuring data security. Do you have a moment to chat about this?
Best regards, -Amelia ---
Hi Amelia,
Great to hear from you. I'm aware of the Romulus server situation, and I agree it's essential to handle it properly. Let's discuss it. How about we schedule a meeting to go over the details? What time works for you?
Best regards, -Ben

email.subject: RE(2): Urgent: Security Breach Prevention - Action Required

mailServer.email:
Riley,
I've engaged our IT team, and they're currently working on identifying the source of the anomalies. I've also alerted our incident response team to be on standby. The situation seems to be contained for now, but we're closely monitoring the situation.
I'll provide you with hourly updates or sooner if we have any significant findings.
Best, -Amelia ---
Amelia,
Thank you for your swift action and the ongoing updates. Please ensure that we maintain a high level of security vigilance during this period. The sooner we can identify the source and close any vulnerabilities, the better.
If you need any additional resources or support, please don't hesitate to reach out. We must do everything in our power to protect our systems and data.
Best, -Riley

email.subject: RE: Urgent: Security Breach Prevention - Action Required

mailServer.email:
Hi Riley,
I'm on it. I'll start by checking the logs and monitoring our network traffic. If this is indeed an attempted breach, we need to act fast to identify the source and plug any vulnerabilities. I'll keep you posted on any findings.
Thanks for bringing this to my attention.
Best, -Amelia ---
Amelia,
Great, thank you for your prompt response. Let's not leave any stone unturned. Please coordinate with our IT team and initiate a thorough investigation. Also, inform our incident response team to be on standby in case we need to contain any breach.
Keep me updated throughout the process, and don't hesitate to escalate this issue if you deem it necessary.
Best regards, -Riley

email.subject: Urgent: Security Breach Prevention - Action Required

mailServer.email:
Hi Amelia,
I hope this message finds you well. I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but we've got a potentially serious security issue on our hands. Our security systems just detected an unusual spike in network traffic and some unauthorized access attempts. This could be the precursor to a breach.
I need your immediate assistance in investigating this matter further. Could you please take a look into our logs and see if you can identify the source of these anomalies?
Thanks, -Riley

Best, -Amelia

Hello all,
Let me first say that progress has been exceptional. Despite some setbacks we ran into with the connections module, we've come out of it still within our goal deadline margins. You've all done great work. Some of the trouble points we established early on are being addressed by some outside contractors, who are showing impressive results!
The project has been, I think, enlightening for everyone, and continues to reinforce my thoughts that this is the right way to address the problems digital security has at the moment. By pushing current systems to the limits like this ourselves, we've made huge bounds in progress of EnSec development and theory - the projects are helping each other now more than ever, and it's so encouraging to see.
More updates soon to come, Keep up the good work, -RC

Hello all, One of our engineers has expressed concerns about the direction of the project. I quote: "If used maliciously, this could be an extremely dangerous tool we're building. Unless you can guarantee that distribution will be extremely carefully tracked and monitored, I'm not sure I can continue work on the project in good faith".
It's an exceptional point, and in the interests of transparency, something I want to talk about with the whole company. As I said before, this distribution locking and tracking was something we Identified early on in the design as something troublesome. One of the inherent problems with building powerful tools is their misuse comes with powerful consequences. This problem area is one of the instances where I felt engaging outside expert's help was our best course of action, and they are one of the ones showing great results. While I don't have the finished product to demonstrate yet, rest assured that it's an issue I'm aware of, and want to keep talking about. For now, *all* build come with a security tracer embedded that automatically activates at random intervals, helping track rogue builds even in this early stage.
Keep up the good work, -RC

Hey,
You probably should have been set up with this at the start, but the Romulus admin pass is:
h7ggNKl2
You should have a link to it on your desktop, but if you don't connect to 156.151.1.12 and you should be good to go.
glgl, -Ben

Hello, and welcome to the Hacknet team. Due to the delicate nature of the project, much of your participation in the team will be kept isolated from other components in the project, and seeing complete assembled builds of the project will be rare, if ever. Because of this, we wanted to give everyone a bit more context as to the project's overall goals.
Hackent OS has been designed from the ground up as a groundbreaking computer security examination and penetration testing framework. EnTech is producing this as a companion to it's new digital security software suite (EnSec), as a marketing and presentation device to demonstrate it's superiority over conventional security packages. At it's heart, hacknet is a marketing device, but as an individual project it's one of the most ambitious and powerful AntiSec tools ever created.
Welcome to the team - I'm sure you'll agree it's an incredibly exciting project to be a part of. -Hacknet Team Management

Greetings, and welcome to EnTech! We're currently working on two big projects, and you'll be getting a more detailed project introduction for your team shortly, but this email is for an overview of our current direction and how the projects fit together. The first is EnSec, a completely new computer security suite, designed to revolutionize computer security. Human error will always be the problem area of any security system, but we believe it should be the *only* problem area. By removing and minimizing the potential for human error in the system, and using our new proprietary systems, digital security's no longer a job - it's a choice. Hacknet OS is the companion project for EnSec, written to demonstrate existing problems with security and provide a strong value proposition for everyone to upgrade to what we believe is truly the best security option.
Welcome aboard! -RC

Payment has been received and our business is concluded. ---
Fuckfuckfuck, what have you done?. This isn't what I wanted. This isn't what i wanted you fucking psychopath! Jesus Christ.

The target is deceased. Payment will proceed AS PROMISED or my employees may take issue with their client. ---
It's not too fucking late if he's not dead yet. Call this off right now, I'm revoking payment. This isn't what I hired you for, for fuck's sake. Personal value to the project aside, I'm not going to be a goddamn accessory to murder because of your stupid misunderstanding.

Sure thing,
User: admin Pass: v19328hQ9
I'll kill the auto-pass-rotation till you're done. -Ben
---- Something's come up, I need access to the mainframe to have a look around. I'll be investigating recent accesses and builds, so I need admin.

It's too late, cant stop it. It's anonymous. You need to be clear about wording if you want specific action taken. --- Dead? What the hell are you talking about? I wanted you to smash up his computers and arrest the guy not fucking kill him. Call this off right now, this has gone far enough, I'll deal with it myself.
The man's a genius, even if he's against the project I want him around. Find a way to stop it for god's sake. If you're serious about this I'm holding you personally responsible. Dont fuck with me here.

I've put out the order. Expensive, but he will be dead within the week. Charged to your account as per normal. ---
Good to have you on board. What exactly are your plans this time? He's important, and well informed.

Understood, I'll take care of it. ---
A former employee's gone rogue and is threatening the project. Unlike most I'm actually concerned that he knows what he's doing and could be a real problem. As much as I hate being so crude about it, This project is too important to me, and to the world to put it at risk over something like this. Can you discourage him? Details are attached. Call him "Bit".
-rc
